page.title: 08ROBERT BURNS AND KILMARNOCK
page.content: A STATUE TO BURNS WAS UNVEILED IN 1878 IN VIEW OF THE TOWN'S CONNECTIONS WITH THE POET. THE FIRST EDITION OF THE POET'S WORK WAS PUBLISHED BY A KILMARNOCK PRINTER JOHN WILSON IN 1786 ON A SITE INSIDE THE TOWN SHOPPING PRECINCT AND MARKED BY A PLAQUE.THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 350 BURNS CLUBS IN THE WORLD THE FIRST BEING GREENOCK BURNS CLUB IN 1801 ALTHOUGH THE KILMARNOCK BURNS CLUB IS GIVEN THE HONOUR OF BEING No O BURNS CLUB AND WAS FOUNDED IN 1806. THE No 0CLUB HAS ABOUT 80 MEMBERS AND MEETS ON St.ANDREWS DAY FOR A DINNER AND ON JAN. 25 FOR THE ANNUAL SUPPER. IT IS NOT UNCOMMON FOR WELL KNOWN BURNS SPEAKERS TO BE INVITED TO OTHER BURNS CLUBS IN JANUARY AS FAR AFIELD AS W. AFRICA CANADA AND MOSCOW. CONTD.
